result.execSummary:
The defendant Tilor H Bulpin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 per month payment plan commencing in September 2015. $15.00 payment plan fee agreed to on the record to be added on.
If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine & costs in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the Court for Expungement under 973.015

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tilor H Bulpin

defendant.name: Bulpin, Tilor H

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tilor H Bulpin in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided and it is to the State's understanding that the defendant would like to accept that offer.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Hendee has no objection to expungement with conditions.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the offer.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.


BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in September

  If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.

Pre-trial conference at 07-14-2015 01:15 pm.
Return date at 08-19-2015 03:30 pm.

Defendant Tilor H Bulpin in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court questions defendant and finds waiver of counsel made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Signature bond set.  Return date scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
copy of letter D.A. sent defendant regarding Court date
